articles.headline: From Cuba to Miami by Providence and a Homemade Boat
articles.snippet: A motley group of Cuban refugees risked their lives at sea for five days to reach the United States and a new future. Many others are not so lucky.
articles.abstract: A motley group of Cuban refugees risked their lives at sea for five days to reach the United States and a new future. Many others are not so lucky.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — The sign from God and the Virgin Mary came near the end of their perilous, sun-scorched journey from Cuba to Florida: A dozen or so dolphins swam up to their home-built, overloaded sailboat, dipping in and out of the water, guiding them, they felt, toward a reimagined future.

articles.headline: Exxon Investors Seek Assurance as Climate Shifts, Along With Attitudes
articles.snippet: A growing chorus of shareholders is worried the energy giant is not adequately preparing for tighter times in light of the Paris accord.
articles.abstract: A growing chorus of shareholders is worried the energy giant is not adequately preparing for tighter times in light of the Paris accord.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Exxon Mobil has been under pressure for over a year to explain its handling of climate change issues in the past. Now the company faces new pressure to explain its future, particularly how it will change in response to a warming world.
articles.byline: By Clifford Krauss and John Schwartz

articles.headline: U.S. Strike on Taliban Leader Is Seen as a Message to Pakistan
articles.snippet: President Obama described Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour’s death as an “important milestone,” but it also illustrated the tangled relationship between Washington and Islamabad.
articles.abstract: President Obama described Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour’s death as an “important milestone,” but it also illustrated the tangled relationship between Washington and Islamabad.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Early on Saturday, a middle-aged Pashtun man used forged documents to cross from Iran into Pakistan. A few hours later, on a lonely stretch of highway, he was incinerated by an American drone.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Matthew Rosenberg

articles.headline: ‘Ghostbusters’ Steps Right Into the Hostility of Gender Politics
articles.snippet: Sony Pictures wants male moviegoers to stay interested in its reboot. Hillary Clinton seeks women supporters. Ellen DeGeneres is mixing things up.
articles.abstract: Sony Pictures wants male moviegoers to stay interested in its reboot. Hillary Clinton seeks women supporters. Ellen DeGeneres is mixing things up.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Sony Pictures needs to keep male moviegoers interested in its “Ghostbusters” reboot after an Internet attack on its female cast. Hillary Clinton wants women to throw their support behind her presidential campaign.
articles.byline: By Michael Cieply and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: Gawker Founder Suspects a Common Financer Behind Lawsuits
articles.snippet: Nick Denton, Gawker’s founder, is questioning whether lawsuits brought by Hulk Hogan and others against the site might have been bankrolled by the same source.
articles.abstract: Nick Denton, Gawker’s founder, is questioning whether lawsuits brought by Hulk Hogan and others against the site might have been bankrolled by the same source.
articles.lead_paragraph: At first, Nick Denton, the founder of Gawker Media, thought it an unlikely conspiracy theory.

articles.headline: Dozens of Women Vanish on Canada’s Highway of Tears, and Most Cases Are Unsolved
articles.snippet: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced an inquiry into a series of disappearances and murders, part of a promise to renew the country’s relationship with its indigenous citizens.
articles.abstract: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced an inquiry into a series of disappearances and murders, part of a promise to renew the country’s relationship with its indigenous citizens.
articles.lead_paragraph: SMITHERS, British Columbia — Less than a year after her 15-year-old cousin vanished, Delphine Nikal, 16, was last seen hitchhiking from this isolated northern Canadian town on a spring morning in 1990.

articles.headline: We’ve Seen the Trump Phenomenon Before
articles.snippet: Discontent bred of globalization and economic devastation has precedent in history. Such dynamics preceded both world wars.
articles.abstract: Discontent bred of globalization and economic devastation has precedent in history. Such dynamics preceded both world wars.
articles.lead_paragraph: Why Donald Trump? That’s the big question the stunned Republican establishment, America’s worried allies, and his frazzled Democratic opponents are asking.
